name: Hostal Alaska

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hostal is right in the heart of Sol in Madrid. Excellent location and amazinly friendly owner who will help you out with anything.
reviews.title: Excellent hostal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, have tables and amazing double glazing and shutters (you could have slept all day).
reviews.title: Excellent value in the center of it all

reviews.text: Its up four flights but there is a lift.
reviews.title: Funtastic budget Hostel

reviews.text: Excellent value, will definately return.
reviews.title: Gem!

likes.disliked: — Entry way into the building is dreary

reviews.text: On a very small minus, the walls were very thin (or the Americans next to us were very loud), but I slept in ear plugs, so they were soon forgotten!
reviews.title: Pension Alaska is fantastic!

reviews.text: I stayed in the Hostal for 3 nights on my own, and then 1 additional night with 2 other travelers. They had a nice single and triple room. The Hostal Alaska was in a great location of Madrid to get to the tourist locations and shopping. The rooms were very reasonably priced and clean.
reviews.title: Hostal Alaska is nice, comfortable place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have never stayed at a hostal and was apprehensive when booking it. It was very affordable and the reviews were great. I can tell you I was not disappointed. The room was very roomy and comfortable and immaculate. Our room was overlooking a very small inside courtyard. Because it was not right there on the street thoroughfare, it was the quietest room and the coolest I stayed at in all of Spain. We were in Spain in July for 3 weeks. I slept so well. I would stay there again when in Madrid in a heartbeat. It was right in the heart of Puerta Del Sol area and everything is within walking distance. If you use Rick Steeves book his self guided walking tour starts just down the street from the hostal. It was Great!!!!!
reviews.title: Completely worth it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jill - Seattle, WA
reviews.title: Juan Carlos is the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: The room was spacious and included a corridor with a sitting area (couch and little table) There was also 2 nightstands, a desk and chair, and 2 comfy armchairs ( think i sat in them the most!) The bed was comfy.
reviews.title: Central, with ensuite, TV & air con... and affordable!

likes.disliked: — Very small bathroom, some furniture unclean

reviews.text: Price: the price was very reasonable especially for the city center. there were a lot of shady looking places on the same street but I was glad I picked Hostal Alaska.
reviews.title: A gem in an ideal location!!!
We loved it here.
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay here. While it’s not the most modern place, the room was huge by European standards. Juan Carlos, the owner, could not have been more helpful. My daughter and her infant son joined us for one night and we asked for a crib. He didn’t have one, so he bought one. The rooms were clean and the towels were the best we experienced in Spain. The location is very central and right in the middle of town. While it can be noisy outside, the double windows were very effective and we didn’t hear any outside noise. The building is old, but the elevator worked fine. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Madrid.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good basic hostal at a great price in a fantastic location.
reviews.title: A real find.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are simply furnished but extremely clean with enough space to spread out and relax. En suite bathrooms are tiny but well kept
reviews.title: Nice, clean, well located, unexpensive

reviews.text: Right in the heart of things on a street full of bars and restaurants, the Alaska is the ideal base from which to explore this colourful, exciting and romantic city.
reviews.title: Clean, basic, Excellent location

reviews.text: Given the lively location, we were slightly concerned that getting any sleep was going to be a problem. We needn't have worried, the rooms are so well soundproofed we didn't hear a thing.
reviews.title: Great for budget travel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very central position, thus in an old building. Owner very nice and helpful. Room clean, big, characteristic. Quiet during night. Air conditioning available (not tested)
reviews.title: perfect stay

reviews.text: Well, the very first impression of the Hostal Alaska was not good because the hallway of the building on the street floor is very sinister. It gives a image the you are entering a "trap". However, as soon as you get into the Hostal Alaska itself, the real thing is different. My room were very spacious and well maintained , and the bathroom was ok. As already stated on the other reviews, the biggest advantage of Hostal Alaska is its location, very close to Puerta Del Sol.
reviews.title: The location is good, but the towels...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, one thing simply destroyed my experience at Hostal Alaska: the towels ! They simply stinks ! The first night I felt I was using a used towel, terrible experience ! The next day I asked a change, but the odor persisted. The other day I asked the same thing and the smell was there ! This happened on all our stay there (3 nights).
reviews.title: Is this really the place?

likes.liked: — The owner was friendly but it couldn't make up for the quality of the room
likes.disliked: — The skanky building, the noise, the smell....

reviews.text: If I hadn´t had this issue with the towels, I would probably rate this place better
reviews.title: Central, Comfortable, Pleasant

reviews.text: Well I learned that I MUST pay attention to the negative reviews even if there are 20 excellent reviews. We booked this room based on the positive reviews and we LEFT after our first night.
reviews.title: Best Budget Bet

description: Located in Madrid downtown, 100 m far from Puerta del Sol square, Hostal Alaska offers 7 charming rooms to enjoy your stay in Madrid at best. All rooms include own bathroom, tv, heating & air-conditioning. Free WIFI Access in the whole hostel.Although it's sited on Madrid downtown, very close to every monument & interesting place, we guarantee silence & quietness for your rest.
